senses.sense_definition: Of or relating to the French writer and philosopher <w>Voltaire</w>, his works, or his characteristic style of wit, skepticism, and defense of civil liberties.

examples.text: The author is well known for his <w>Voltairean</w> wit and sharp criticism of political hypocrisy.
She approached the debate with a <w>Voltairean</w> spirit, questioning every established dogma.

traits.comment: used in contexts discussing literature or philosophy
referring to the style or attitude rather than the person

senses.sense_definition: A person who follows or admires the philosophy of <w>Voltaire</w>, typically characterized by rationalism and skepticism.

examples.text: As a dedicated <w>Voltairean</w>, he argued passionately for the absolute freedom of speech.
The professor described herself as a <w>Voltairean</w> regarding matters of religion and state.

traits.comment: used in intellectual or historical discussions
